required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 10, 2022
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sequential Dose-escalation Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of TB006 in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Double-blind, Randomized, Single Dose, Sequential Dose-escalation Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of TB006 in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single dose, dose-escalation study to assess the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of TB006, a monoclonal antibody that will be studied as a disease modifying treatment for Alzheimer's disease.

detailed_description.textblock: The TB006 nonclinical pharmacology program establishes its potential as a therapeutic agent for AD. Overall, the data suggest the potential for beneficial therapeutic effects of TB006 in addressing underlying pathology and ameliorating the course of AD. The preclinical safety profile of TB006 further supports the clinical investigation of TB006. This is a Phase 1 SAD study in healthy adult subjects. The study will evaluate the safety, tolerability, and PK of single doses of TB006, administered as an IV infusion over 1 hour.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Six dose groups are planned: 5 dose levels of TB006 in healthy subjects and 1 ethno-bridging group in healthy subjects of Chinese descent.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects and rate of treatment-emergent adverse events, graded by CTCAE Version 5.0, by dose group and all active treatment vs. placebo
primary_outcome.description: To measure the incidence of AEs and SAEs, clinical laboratory parameters, and vital signs until Day 75 after dosing.

primary_outcome.measure: To determine the single-dose PK profile of TB006 in healthy adult subjects
primary_outcome.description: PK parameters derived by noncompartmental analysis using the TB006 plasma concentration-time data

primary_outcome.measure: To determine the MTD of single doses of TB006 in healthy adult subjects
primary_outcome.description: Dose-response relationship of AEs and SAEs, and other safety outcomes

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic (PK) profile/parameters: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC) through Day 29
Pharmacokinetic (PK) profile/parameters: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC)
Pharmacokinetic (PK) profile/parameters: Maximum observed plasma concentration
Pharmacokinetic (PK) profile/parameters: Time at which maximum plasma concentration occurs
Pharmacokinetic (PK) profile/parameters: terminal elimination phase half life
Pharmacokinetic (PK) profile/parameters: Extent of CSF distribution as estimated by TB006 CSF concentrations

secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects and rate of treatment-emergent adverse events, graded by CTCAE Version 5.0, by dose group and all active treatment vs. placebo in non-Chinese healthy and Chinese healthy subjects
Number and rate of subjects who develop anti-TB006 antibodies

arm_group.description: 0.9% normal saline infused intravenously over 1 hour

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy volunteers, male or female 18-55 at the time of informed consent
- In good health as determined by the principal investigator
- Body weight of ≥ 50 kg and BMI within the range 18-30 kg/m2 (inclusive).
- Chinese subjects are eligible to be included in the study if all of the following criteria apply in addition to the above: Must have been born in China, with 2 Chinese biological parents and 4 Chinese grandparents as confirmed by interview; Must have lived no more than 10 years outside of China; Must not have changed their lifestyle or habits significantly, including diet, since leaving China.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any current history of clinically significant disease in the opinion of the investigator or receiving maintenance medications on a daily basis.
- Any active or unstable clinically significant medical or psychiatric condition as judged by the investigator.
- Smokes cigarettes or uses other nicotine-containing products (eg, snuff, nicotine patch, nicotine chewing gum, mock cigarettes, or inhalers), and has done so in the 3 months prior to screening.
- Regular alcohol consumption within 6 months prior to the study defined as: an average weekly intake of > 20 units for males or > 16 units for females. One unit is equivalent to 8 glasses of alcohol: a half pint (∼240 mL) of beer, 1 glass (125 mL) of wine or 1 (25 mL) measure of spirits.
